vision.style_notes: elegant, descriptive prose with period detail; natural, witty dialogue with subtle hints; clues revealed as discoveries; slow, deliberate pacing

entity::the_host.concept: The reclusive, impeccably dressed host of the estate, known for hosting tea parties with a veneer of charm.
entity::the_host.notes: Speaks in measured, elegant phrases. Their presence is both soothing and subtly ominous. Alters tea rituals and invites only select guests, suggesting a hidden agenda.

entity::the_butler.concept: A stoic, silent figure who manages all operations of the house.
entity::the_butler.notes: Wears a dark suit, carries a silver cane. Observes everything with quiet intensity. Silence is a form of power; actions are precise and mechanical. Dilemma over whether they are loyal or a silent observer with hidden purpose.

entity::the_viscount.concept: A distant, aristocratic relative with a history of eccentric behavior.
entity::the_viscount.notes: Appears at tea parties with sharp wit and cryptic remarks. Words contain subtle hints or contradictions ignored by others. Represents the family’s past.

entity::the_lady_of_the_garden.concept: A mysterious woman who tends the estate’s garden.
entity::the_lady_of_the_garden.notes: Rarely speaks, but movements are precise and deliberate. Often seen pruning roses at twilight. Suggests knowledge of a secret tied to the garden’s hidden path.

entity::the_young_mistress.concept: The host’s niece, a bright, observant young woman with a sharp intellect.
entity::the_young_mistress.notes: Only one who notices inconsistencies in tea party rituals. Recognizes a false alibi, making her pivotal to solving the mystery. Intelligence is subtle and becomes crucial.

entity::the_caretaker.concept: A man who maintains the estate’s outbuildings.
entity::the_caretaker.notes: Speaks in hushed tones, avoids eye contact. Silence and careful movements suggest he is guarding or knows something.

entity::the_maid.concept: A young woman who serves tea and delivers messages.
entity::the_maid.notes: Polite demeanor, eyes betray nervousness. Her small details—like a dropped note—may be the first real clue. Window into hidden routines.

entity::the_gardener.concept: A man with deep knowledge of plants.
entity::the_gardener.notes: Claims to have seen a 'shadow' in the garden at night. Words are dismissed initially but echo the idea that the garden is a living, breathing space with hidden logic.

entity::the_hall.concept: The grand entrance hall, lined with portraits and chandeliers.
entity::the_hall.notes: Sets the tone—elegant, formal, yet subtly oppressive. Guests' entry mirrors tea party rituals, establishing order and control.

entity::the_library.concept: A vaulted room filled with antique books, maps, and a large mahogany desk.
entity::the_library.notes: Center of intellectual life. Holds secrets and history. Mirror distorts reflection, symbolizing that truth is not always visible.

entity::the_garden.concept: A sprawling, overgrown garden with stone paths and a hidden path leading to the west wing.
entity::the_garden.notes: Setting for private moments. Beautiful and unsettling. Curtain swings in wind; when pulled, reveals a hidden compartment. Suggests it is a living, breathing space with hidden logic.

entity::the_balcony.concept: A high, narrow balcony overlooking the estate.
entity::the_balcony.notes: Used for quiet conversations and late-night observations. Space of intimacy and surveillance where characters speak without being heard.

entity::the_study.concept: A private room with a large window and a writing desk.
entity::the_study.notes: The host’s domain. Decisions are made here. Private thoughts revealed through object placement and lighting.

entity::the_kitchen.concept: A warm, cluttered room where tea is prepared.
entity::the_kitchen.notes: Source of the tea ritual. Every detail—pouring, cup order—is part of a carefully constructed routine that may be a trap.

entity::the_west_wing.concept: A sealed, unopened wing with no recorded access.
entity::the_west_wing.notes: Appears in the garden’s shadow. Existence is never confirmed but referenced in garden history, suggesting it may be the site of a past incident.

entity::the_tea_set.concept: A vintage porcelain set with a chipped teacup, used at every tea party.
entity::the_tea_set.notes: Centerpiece of the ritual. Chipped cup appears in one room but not another—suggests deliberate inconsistency noticed by the young mistress.

entity::the_golden_key.concept: A small, ornate key hidden in the library’s bookshelf.
entity::the_golden_key.notes: Only one such key in estate history. Opens the family diary. Presented as central artifact, but true function revealed only upon opening the diary.

entity::the_silver_candlestick.concept: A candlestick with a cracked handle, found in the garden.
entity::the_silver_candlestick.notes: Matches description from a 1930s journal. Physical link to past. Appearance in garden suggests continuity between present and past.

entity::the_family_diary.concept: A leather-bound journal from the 1920s, detailing the family’s history and secrets.
entity::the_family_diary.notes: Locked behind a false panel. Contains truth about the incident that began the tea party rituals—what happened that night and why it was hidden.

entity::the_mirror_in_the_library.concept: A large, ornate mirror with a faint crack.
entity::the_mirror_in_the_library.notes: Reflects not just the face, but a distorted version of the room. Symbolizes fragility of perception—what we see may not be real.

entity::the_curtain_in_the_garden.concept: A heavy, old curtain that swings in the wind.
entity::the_curtain_in_the_garden.notes: When pulled, reveals a hidden compartment. Literal and symbolic gateway to hidden truth—the garden is a place of revelation.

entity::the_tea_party_circle.concept: A group of guests who attend weekly tea parties.
entity::the_tea_party_circle.notes: Interactions are ritualistic and follow unspoken rules. Believe in tradition, but compliance may be complicity.

entity::the_garden_watch.concept: A secret group of caretakers and gardeners who monitor the estate’s hidden spaces.
entity::the_garden_watch.notes: Believe the garden holds a hidden truth. Communicate in hushed tones and share coded observations.

entity::the_archive_wardens.concept: A small, elite group responsible for guarding the library and its contents.
entity::the_archive_wardens.notes: Enforce strict rules about access and silence. Create sense of institutional control—knowledge is power and is tightly guarded.

dilemma::host_benevolent_or_self_serving.question: Is the host benevolent or self-serving?
dilemma::host_benevolent_or_self_serving.why_it_matters: Defines the moral center of the story. If benevolent, the mystery is a social puzzle; if self-serving, it becomes a power play.

dilemma::host_benevolent_or_self_serving.description: The host is benevolent. Their actions are consistent with social grace and tradition.
The host is self-serving. Their actions—such as altering tea rituals and selecting guests—mask a deeper motive of power or control.

dilemma::library_knowledge_salvation_or_.question: Is the library’s knowledge salvation or corruption?
dilemma::library_knowledge_salvation_or_.why_it_matters: Explores the cost of knowledge. Access to truth may offer clarity or lead to moral collapse.

dilemma::library_knowledge_salvation_or_.description: The knowledge is salvation. The diary reveals a truth that resolves the mystery without violence.
The knowledge is corruption. It may have been used to manipulate the guests, unraveling the estate’s foundation.

dilemma::garden_sanctuary_or_trap.question: Is the garden a sanctuary or a trap?
dilemma::garden_sanctuary_or_trap.why_it_matters: Establishes emotional and physical stakes. The garden is both a setting and a place of revelation.

dilemma::garden_sanctuary_or_trap::alt::.description: The garden is a sanctuary. It offers refuge and truth, with the curtain revealing a safe space where the truth is shared.
The garden is a trap. It may conceal danger or deception, and the hidden path could be a site of violence or manipulation.

dilemma::can_butler_be_trusted.question: Can the butler be trusted?
dilemma::can_butler_be_trusted.why_it_matters: Challenges reader assumptions about loyalty. The butler is the only one who sees everything.

dilemma::can_butler_be_trusted::alt::tru.description: The butler is trusted. Their actions align with the established rules of the estate.

dilemma::can_butler_be_trusted::alt::unt.description: The butler is not trusted. Their silence and precision suggest they are hiding something and may be the true culprit.

dilemma::did_young_mistress_notice_false.question: Did the young mistress notice the false alibi?
dilemma::did_young_mistress_notice_false.why_it_matters: Centers on perception and intelligence. The young mistress is the only character with sharp observational skills.

dilemma::did_young_mistress_notice_false.description: The young mistress noticed the false alibi. Her insight becomes the pivotal clue.
The young mistress did not notice the false alibi. The solution remains hidden.

dilemma::golden_key_real_clue_or_red_her.question: Is the golden key the real clue or a red herring?
dilemma::golden_key_real_clue_or_red_her.why_it_matters: Tests the player’s ability to discern significance. The key is presented as central but may be misleading.

dilemma::golden_key_real_clue_or_red_her.description: The golden key is the real clue. It leads to the family diary and unlocks the solution.
The golden key is a red herring. It distracts the player from the true clue.

dilemma::tea_ritual_tradition_or_trap.question: Is the tea ritual a tradition or a trap?
dilemma::tea_ritual_tradition_or_trap.why_it_matters: Explores the illusion of normalcy. The ritual appears harmless but may conceal deeper manipulation.

dilemma::tea_ritual_tradition_or_trap::a.description: The tea ritual is a tradition. It reflects the estate’s values and history and appears harmless.
The tea ritual is a trap. It may be designed to mislead or control guests, undermining the illusion of normalcy.

dilemma::did_caretaker_witness_incident.question: Did the caretaker witness the night of the incident?
dilemma::did_caretaker_witness_incident.why_it_matters: Introduces a gap in the timeline. The caretaker has access to outbuildings where the incident may have occurred.

dilemma::did_caretaker_witness_incident:.description: The caretaker did not witness the incident. Their account is unreliable and the truth remains obscured.
The caretaker did witness the incident. They may hold a vital piece of evidence.

path::host_motive.name: The Host’s Benevolence
path::host_motive.description: Is the host hosting tea parties to preserve tradition—or to maintain control?

path::library_knowledge.name: The Diary’s Truth
path::library_knowledge.description: Does the diary reveal a solution—or a dangerous truth that corrupts the estate?

path::garden_nature.name: The Garden’s Sanctuary
path::garden_nature.description: Is the garden a safe space of truth—or a trap hiding danger?

path::butler_loyalty.name: The Butler’s Silence
path::butler_loyalty.description: Can the butler be trusted? Is their silence loyalty—or a cover for guilt?

consequence::host_motive_benevolent_to_s.description: If the host is self-serving, the tea ritual is manipulated to maintain control over guests, revealing the host's true motive is power, not tradition.
narrative_effects: Establishes the host as morally ambiguous
Shifts the story from a social puzzle to a power struggle
Creates dilemma between appearance and reality

consequence::library_knowledge_salvation.description: The diary reveals a hidden truth about a past fire, which corrupts the estate's history and causes moral collapse among the guests.
narrative_effects: Introduces a dangerous truth that undermines trust
Creates emotional conflict and personal risk for characters
Shifts the resolution from peace to tragedy

consequence::garden_sanctuary_to_trap.description: The garden is not a safe space but a trap that hides the true incident, with the curtain revealing a hidden compartment containing evidence of violence.
narrative_effects: Transforms the garden from a symbol of peace to a site of danger
Introduces physical and emotional stakes in the garden
Creates a climax where the truth is hidden behind natural forms

consequence::butler_loyalty_trusted_to_u.description: The butler's silence is not loyalty but a cover for guilt, and the removal of the chipped cup suggests they are hiding evidence of the incident.
narrative_effects: Raises suspense about the butler's role in the incident
Challenges the audience's assumptions about trust and service
Makes the butler a potential culprit

consequence::tea_ritual_altered_by_host.description: The tea ritual is changed in height and timing, signaling the host's manipulation of tradition to assert control.
narrative_effects: Shows the host's active interference in social rituals
Establishes a pattern of subtle control
Creates a sense of unease in the tea party dynamics

consequence::young_mistress_discovered_c.description: The young mistress notices the chipped cup is missing from the tea set, indicating a deliberate alteration of the ritual.
narrative_effects: Introduces a key inconsistency in the tea ritual
Highlights the young mistress's sharp observational skills
Sets up a false alibi for the host

consequence::butler_repositions_tea_set_.description: The butler silently repositions the tea set after the guest leaves, suggesting awareness of the ritual's manipulation.
narrative_effects: Implies the butler is aware of the host's deception
Creates a sense of silent surveillance
Builds dilemma around the butler's role in the estate

consequence::garden_curtain_swings_in_wi.description: The young mistress sees the curtain in the garden swing in the wind, indicating hidden movement within the garden space.
narrative_effects: Introduces the garden as a place of active, unseen action
Establishes the garden as a living, responsive environment
Sets up the possibility of danger or memory

beat::1.1.summary: The host invites a new guest to tea. The tea ritual is altered—tea is poured from a different height.

dilemma_impacts.note: Shows the ritual is not fixed, indicating the host has control over tradition, suggesting self-serving motives.

beat::1.2.summary: The young mistress notices the chipped cup is missing from the tea set.

dilemma_impacts.note: Reveals an inconsistency in the tea ritual, setting up a false alibi and suggesting the butler may have altered the scene.
The young mistress observes the anomaly, confirming her sharp observational skills and establishing her role as a key narrator.

beat::1.3.summary: The butler silently repositions the tea set after the guest leaves.

dilemma_impacts.note: The butler's action suggests awareness of the ritual's manipulation, raising doubt about their loyalty and intentions.

beat::1.4.summary: The host comments: ‘Tradition is not about rules—it’s about what we choose to preserve.’

dilemma_impacts.note: The host’s words reveal a self-serving motive—preserving control over the estate, not tradition or benevolence.

beat::2.1.summary: The young mistress finds a note in the library: ‘Do not open the diary.’

dilemma_impacts.note: Introduces the diary as a forbidden object, setting up the possibility of dangerous truths being hidden.

beat::2.2.summary: The mirror in the library shows a distorted version of the room—like a memory.

dilemma_impacts.note: Suggests the diary contains fragmented truths, implying the knowledge is corrupted or distorted.

beat::2.3.summary: The caretaker recalls seeing a man in the west wing at night.

dilemma_impacts.note: Introduces a timeline gap and suggests the incident occurred, raising questions about what happened in the west wing.
The west wing is linked to the garden, suggesting danger may be present there.

beat::2.4.summary: The diary reveals the incident: a fire that killed a guest. The host was present.

dilemma_impacts.note: The diary contains a dangerous truth—corruption—showing the host covered up a fatal incident.

beat::3.1.summary: The young mistress sees the curtain in the garden swing in the wind.

dilemma_impacts.note: Introduces the garden as a place of active movement, suggesting hidden actions or life within it.

beat::3.2.summary: The lady of the garden prunes a rose that has no bloom.

dilemma_impacts.note: Suggests the garden is alive and aware, implying it may be a living space of memory or danger.

beat::3.3.summary: The caretaker says: ‘I saw a shadow in the garden at night—like a man.’

dilemma_impacts.note: Introduces a physical threat in the garden, suggesting it may be a trap hiding danger.

beat::3.4.summary: Pulling the curtain reveals a hidden compartment with a silver candlestick.

dilemma_impacts.note: The garden is revealed as a sanctuary—its hidden compartment contains a physical link to the past, confirming its role as a place of preservation.
The silver candlestick is a physical artifact tied to the past, suggesting the knowledge is preserved, not corrupted.

beat::4.1.summary: The butler serves tea with perfect timing—every second is correct.

dilemma_impacts.note: Demonstrates the butler’s precision and control, suggesting deep understanding of the ritual and possibly its manipulation.

beat::4.2.summary: The young mistress notices the butler never speaks to the guests.

dilemma_impacts.note: Highlights the butler’s silence as a form of power, raising suspicion about their true intentions.

beat::4.3.summary: The butler removes a tea cup from the set and places it in a drawer.

dilemma_impacts.note: Suggests the butler is hiding evidence, challenging the idea of their loyalty and creating suspense.

beat::4.4.summary: The host says: ‘He is not a servant. He is a guardian.’

dilemma_impacts.note: The host defends the butler, implying loyalty and a protective role, but the action is ambiguous—leaving room for doubt.

convergence_points: The garden’s hidden compartment (Beat 3.4) contains the silver candlestick.
The family diary (Beat 2.4) reveals the incident occurred in the west wing.
The tea set (Beat 1.2) and chipped cup are found in the kitchen, but the butler moved it.
The mirror in the library reflects a distorted version of the garden and west wing.
residue_notes: The garden remains a place of mystery—its full truth is not known.
The butler’s loyalty is never fully confirmed—only implied.
The host’s words are elegant, but their actions reveal a quiet control.
